title: ANYONE KNOW THIS CONDENSED FONT?
content:
See website below,

[http://www.warchild.org.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063804/http:/www.warchild.org.uk/ "http://www.warchild.org.uk")

Need to use the condesed font used in capitals throughout the site, does anyone know exactly what it is? I know a few similar but, not the same. Any help appreciated.

cheers

 [‹ Golf Digest font ?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063804/http:/typophile.com/node/39181 "Go to previous forum topic") [anyone have a guess at this? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063804/http:/typophile.com/node/39174 "Go to next forum topic")
author: OTTER

comments.content:
It looks like Din Condensed from Paratype.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063804/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/paratype/din-condensed/")

Regards

Cheers for that, thought it was DIN but the version I have been using didn’t have the right ’O’ which was confusing me.

Thanks
Closest I can think of is [DIN 1451 Engschrift](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208063804/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/din-1451/). But it’s not an exact match.
